cs.IT, cs.FL, cs.DS, cs.NI, cs.SI. 

The paper deals with coding theory and decoding algorithms, which are typically studied in the Information Theory (cs.IT) sub-category. The use of graph representations and edge colorings is also a common topic in the Graph Theory (cs.DS) sub-category. The differential evolution algorithm mentioned in the paper falls under the category of optimization and search algorithms, which are studied in the Machine Learning (cs.LG) and Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) sub-categories. Finally, the analysis of stopping sets and the performance evaluation of the proposed decoding algorithm can be considered as applications of network information theory, which is studied in the Network Information Theory (cs.NI) and Signal Processing (cs.SI) sub-categories.
